title: Fanore To Ballyvaughan Walk Route

images.title: Dr Charles Nelson / waterfalls on mountainside, Aghaglinny North, The Burren
images.caption: Waterfalls on mountainside, Aghaglinny North, The Burren. Being a karst landscape water seeps underground rapidly, through cracks in the limestone. After heavy rain, the hill side can weep with water.

images.title: The jetty at Ballyvaughan by Rod Allday, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The jetty at Ballyvaughan

description: This walk takes you from Fanore to Ballyvaughan on the west coast of Ireland. The walk runs along a coastal path with wonderful views over the Aran Islands, Galway Bay, Connemara and the hills of the Burren. Fanore includes a popular beach and sand dunes (known as the "Rabbit Warren") around the mouth of the Caher River. Fanor is also notable as the longest village in Europe. You can continue your walking in the area on the Ballyvaughan Wood Loop Walk . On the circular walk you can visit the wonderful Aillwee Cave system with its underground river and waterfall.
